**Tool Overview**:

The Hypervisor Protected Code Integrity (HVCI) tool is a security feature that aims to enhance the security posture of Windows environments by leveraging hypervisor capabilities to protect critical system components. **Details**:

This tool works by ensuring that only trusted code is executed in kernel mode, thus preventing malicious code from running. HVCI is particularly beneficial where there is a need to safeguard against security feature bypass vulnerabilities related to Windows operating systems. To deploy the tool, administrators should ensure that hardware virtualization is enabled in the BIOS and that the necessary Windows features are activated via Windows Settings or Group Policy. The monitoring of HVCI can be performed through the
